subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_005B_01C9D54D.D87E3E40
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Here's the thing though - if you put something out there, and ask people to=
 listen to it, your inviting opinions. Some will be in agreement, and some =
won't, no matter what.

If EVP messages are for the one that recorded them,=
 then it shouldn't surprise you, or offend you, if someone doesn't hear the=
 same thing you do. If you don't want contrary opinions on something, then =
you should not give people the chance to critique.

Now I could see if some=
one flat out said your recordings were all trash, period. You would have ev=
ery right to be angry, but noone is saying that, at least I am not saying t=
hat.

I just stated that I did not hear what James heard, and though I wasn=
't going to say he doesn't have anything, I can't say that he does either.
=

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 11:00 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]=
 Re: what you hear is what you get






  Yeah, and we've all heard the th=
ing about opinions.

   F-s


  On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:53 AM, April Abe=
rcrombie <april@...> wrote:





    Noone is sayi=
ng what they hear is law, just their opinion.

      ----- Original Message=
 ----- 
      From: Frank Sumption 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
    =
  Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 10:43 AM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what=
 you hear is what you get



       Soooo, everyone hears different, and pe=
rsonally I find it offensive when someone presumes to tell everyone what an=
other researhcer's voices really say. I think EVP messages are for the one =
that recorded thmm, to everyone else it's non-sense, except there's enough =
to show that there is a phenomenon. 

       I get really tired of these se=
lf proclaimed experts trying to dicate what's acceptable.

       Frank-S

=

      On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:04 AM, Rick <rasterer@...> wrote:

=



        I opened your folder and examined all your files.

        Here =
are my opinions (I have truncated the file names due to laziness):

       =
 ahh_mmm noises, no speech
        call_us noises, no speech
        cal_us=
 (enhanced) several listenings: pixelated, no speech
        compare_panaso=
nic noises, no speech
        compare_sony noises, no speech
        first_=
epv noises, no speech
        good_whistle noises, no speech (maybe feedbac=
k)
        hey_can noises, no speech
        hey_whats noises, no speech
  =
      I_hit noises, no speech
        important_date noises, no speech
    =
    keep_moving several listenings: Hellalal see woobeh 
        laugh_evp =
noises, no speech
        lets_wait several listenings: noises, no speech
 =
       maybe_gun noises, no speech
        miss_you noises, no speech
     =
   my_question several listenings: no da lee
        oh_ noises, no speech
=
        something several listenings: noises, no speech
        that_mans n=
oises, no speech
        that's_jim noises, no speech
        this_one seve=
ral listenings: noises, no speech
        tomorrow noises, no speech

     =
   The ones that took several listenings I thought I might hear words in, s=
o I examined those several times. Sometimes I could sort of hear something =
that sort of sounded like what you suggested, but I could also hear it in o=
ther ways, or not at all.

        So my suggestion to you, if you want to =
get less subjective conjuctures or simply less affirmations of your own int=
erpretations, is to post the future ones without labels. The labels you giv=
e can influence the listeners: when you have a sound that could be several =
things, and you note that it sounded like "keep it moving", the listener ca=
n find it nearly impossible to try NOT to hear what you heard, and so not b=
e able to give a fresh perspecive to help your research methods. 



      =
  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "James W. Hyslope" <clockdryve@...> wrote=
:
        >
        > Go to my Folder in the files section "Jim's RR-DR60 E=
VP's" and see if anyone (needs to) decide "FOR ME" and let me know if I am =
of the serious type. In my short time I have gathered enough "proof" for my=
self that this method works for ME. And from what I have seen from others t=
hat I have let "listen" to my files (friends) I am blessed with the "abilit=
y" to HEAR very low audio artifacts....so this will help me in my RESEARCH.=
 And I am OPEN to any help to reach my goals (or help others) with their go=
als. Have fun people. On a HAPPIER NOTE :) I was lucky enough to catch the =
RR-DR60 taking a nap yesterday....it missed a few evp's real close together=
 (in a 5 second clip) the Sony ICD-B7 heard a male use a different number t=
han what I used. I said 16 (my earlier age I was saying in recorder) and th=
e male evp said 13....then a female laughs. All this was missed by the DR60=
 (except my 16 was recorded in both recorders) BUT then the DR60 "caught" t=
he B7 "napping" at near the end of the 5 second clip....the DR60 heard "let=
 me out" in a clear (quite) males voice. So this is very promising piece of=
 evidence for me. **those 2 recordings have been uploaded to my folder. I w=
ill include an Olympus W-10 (soon as arrives), Panasonic RR-US360 (when I t=
hink to grab it) and my RR-QR80 to go with my RR-QR100, and one more (can't=
 remember what brand-model of this last---due to arrive) LOL. I need to bui=
ld a multiple mounting devise to aid in putting these into tandem service. =
Then I think I will use my Olympus DS-50 as my "Control" recorder....by usi=
ng it on the HQ settings. I am looking to build a "subsonic" microphone als=
o (something to do with those low "booms" that I have noticed lead or follo=
w many evp's). So I look forward to any ideas. Falure is NOT an option. Hah=
a.....
        >
